programme.title: Myths & Monsters
programme.desc: The strange Slavic story of Ivan and Koschei the Deathless; the origins of King Arthur and the wizard Merlin; Odysseus resists the song of the Sirens; Sigurd and his battle with the dragon Fafnir.

programme.title: Myths & Monsters
programme.desc: The tragic Greek myth of Actaeon, who stumbled upon the goddess Artemis; the Celtic Otherworld, an idyllic place of magic and beauty; the Kraken; venturing into the woods of the Brothers Grimm.

programme.title: Myths & Monsters
programme.desc: Romulus and Remus; Vikings and the Valkyries who ushered them to the next world; the Trojan War; how Homer's "The Iliad" influenced Alexander the Great; Vlad the Impaler.

programme.title: Myths & Monsters
programme.desc: The medieval romance of Tristan and Isolde; how the abandonment of Dido by Aeneas paved the way for Rome; Norse attitudes of sex and marriage in "Lay of Thrym"; Medea murders her children.

programme.title: Myths & Monsters
programme.desc: The role of myths and legends in the establishment of the rules of society, as well as the punishments that result from the violation of the rules.

programme.title: Myths & Monsters
programme.desc: The ancient Greek myth of Antigone, who defied laws to bury her dead brother; the Norse god Baldr; flood narratives found in myth; fascination with the undead; history of the vampire.

programme.desc: In a world run by monarchs, the United States announced an unprecedented democratic experiment whose success was far from guaranteed.

programme.title: Modern Explorers
programme.desc: Action sports friends go wing-suit flying from Monte Brento in the Italian Alps, which is a great place to try new tricks in a wing suit; for a paralyzed friend from Dubai, United Arab Emirates, it is also the perfect place to keep on jumping.
